message: President Obama violated the will of the electorate when he forced through countless lame-duck regulations.   When this bill passes the Senate and is signed into Law by President-elect Donald Trump, Congress will be able to overturn  multiple "midnight regulations" en masse with a joint resolution of disapproval.

The Administration should have vetoed this resolution – In light of that, the House passed a Resolution to Object to United Nations Security Council Resolution 2334 as an obstacle to Israeli-Palestinian peace.   Israel remains our strongest ally in the Middle-East; reversing course on decades of established foreign policy was unwarranted and irresponsible.

Today is Law Enforcement Appreciation Day. We cannot say “thank you” enough to our law enforcement officers.   Take a moment from your day to honor all the brave men and women who selflessly protect us. They protect our properties, businesses, and families with honor and distinction. #BackTheBlue

This weekend my office conducted interviews with over 40 students from across the district hoping to serve as our nation’s next generation of Soldiers, Sailors, Airmen, and Marines. I want to thank our Academy Review Board as well as give a special thanks to each and every one of our outstanding applicants!
Congress now can pass a reconciliation bill, repealing all of the budgetary components of Obamacare after President-Elect Trump assumes office.
Outrageous.
Wishing you a speedy recovery Mr. President!
Congratulations to our 45th President, Donald J. Trump!

Congress long-fought for these projects to provide Americans with energy resources and job opportunities.President Trump took a stand, reversing the previous administration's damaging order, and provided for greater energy security and thousands of new American jobs.

Congress seized the opportunity to make the Hyde Amendment permanent and protect our most defenseless and vulnerable population. Our nation must restore its sense of morality, and the swift passage of H.R. 7 serves as a starting point to that restoration.

Congress has advocated for a more secure border for years. Today the President acted. This is about keeping Americans safe and upholding our laws. We must continue to work to stop the influx of illegal immigration along the southern border and protect our country.

This is a time to renew hope as Americans continue to advocate for the respect of all human life. Hundreds of thousands of people from across the Nation and North Texas will march from The National Mall to the Supreme Court.   Congress must continue to stand for legislation that defends the right to life, without which all other rights are impossible.
Yesterday in Washington, I welcomed local Independent School District representatives from Coppell, Hurst-Euless-Bedford, Irving, and Lewisville.
The President has kept his promise to the American people, nominating a stauch defender of liberty and the Constitution to the United States’ highest court.

Congratulations to our nation's 69th secretary of state, Rex Tillerson. I look forward to continue to working with you in advancing U.S. national security and prompting our country's economic interests around the world.
Chris Kyle’s legacy stands as a shining example of courage and heroism; an example we all should strive for. Please join me in saluting the memory of this great American.
Holding the Iranian regime accountable for this and any other illicit behavior must continue if the United States is going to be successful in defending our citizens and our values worldwide.
Remembering our 40th President on his would-be 106th birthday today.   "If we ever forget that we are One Nation Under God, then we will be a nation gone under." - Ronald Reagan

This week, Congress passed the Email Privacy Act. I was a co-sponsor because it protects the constitutional rights of North Texans in the digital age. I hope the Senate will move on it quickly and send it to the President for his signature.

On this day in 1973, "Operation Homecoming" began. Over the next seven weeks, 54 transports returned 591 POWs, including my dear friend and colleague Congressman Sam Johnson, from Vietnam.  Join me in thanking these brave men for their tireless service and great sacrifice and for the families behind them that never lost hope. Thank you to all current and former servicemen and women for vigilantly protecting our nation.  (Photo courtesy USAF)

White House tours are back! Yesterday, the White House announced that tours will resume March 7. If you're planning a trip to Washington, make sure you visit the tour page on my website. We'd love to help you experience our nation's capital!

Congratulations to all the participants at the Digital Divas-Girls in Tech competition! Teams from my alma mater, R. L. Turner High School in Carrollton, placed 2nd and 3rd in the computer programming competition. Participants also heard from female leaders in the tech industry and collected items from vendors.   In total, 53 teams from around the Metroplex and Houston areas were involved in this event.

In the final months of the previous administration, dozens of rules were written by Washington bureaucrats that hurt small businesses, American energy production, retirement accounts, unemployment insurance applications and others. I spoke on the House floor against this overreach by the Executive Branch.   We've already sent a couple resolutions to the President's desk to relieve the pressure placed on Texas families and businesses by the previous administration, more will follow. Watch the floor speech below:   View the summary of our regulatory rollback here: http://www.speaker.gov/general/congressional-review-act-progress-review
Did you hear the news out of NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration today?   Seven earth-size planets found around a single star. Read More Below:
My former colleague and our current Vice President, Mike Pence, gave a very well received speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC), last night. Watch it here if you missed it!
Happy Anniversary to American Legion Post 379 in Bedford, TX! Providing camaraderie and community to veterans in North Texas for 50 years.
It’s Texas Independence Day! 181 years ago in Washington, TX, delegates unanimously declared we are “a free, Sovereign, and independent republic.”

March 6, 1836, the Alamo fell to the Mexican Army, led by General Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna. So great was the legend of the Texans who battled and ultimately lost their lives during the 13 day struggle, they inspired a movement. One month later the Texian Army defeated the Mexican Army at the Battle at San Jacinto – a defining moment in the Texas revolution.

Our health care system is on life support. The American Health Care Act is STEP ONE in keeping our promise to the American people. Last November you voted for repealing and replacing #Obamacare. Today, the Committee on Ways and Means began providing relief to the families, small businesses, and individuals struggling under Obamacare. Learn More: www.readthebill.gop

Today is the 100th birthday of Colleyville (City of Colleyville Government) resident Lt. Col. James "Maggie" Megellas, U.S. Army, Retired. Colonel Megellas is the most decorated officer in the history of the 82nd Airborne Division. More than that, he's remained a tireless advocate for the generations of veterans that followed in his footsteps. Join me in honoring this American hero.

Identity theft is especially hurtful to children because it often goes undiscovered until the child is much older and tries to get a job or a driver's license. Currently, a new social security number can only be issued if damages of identity theft can be produced. This affected constituents of mine that had the social security card of their newborn child stolen out of their mailbox. It's why I introduced The Social Security Child Protection Act (HR 1512). A crucial reform for the Social Security Administration that protects Texas families. (photo credit: US Government)

It was a pleasure to visit The Gatehouse, a faith-based, supportive living community right here in Grapevine. Lisa Rose and her support team are providing women with a means to rebuild their lives after experiencing hardship.  This community, an initiative of projectHandUp, is funded exclusively through private contributions and receives no government assistance whatsoever. The Gatehouse serves as an outstanding example of how the private sector can organize to provide a high-quality service to individuals in need -- providing a hand up instead of a hand out.  The Gatehouse offers an inclusive and safe environment for all residents to begin rebuilding their lives. Their facilities include apartments, a community center, counseling centers, a general store, a clothing boutique, and a chapel.   The Independent Life Program offered here, works with women fleeing or recovering from at-risk situations such as abuse, poverty, and underemployment. This unique program equips women with the tools needed to move forward. Learn more about this inspiring place and the great job Lisa and her team are doing: https://www.gatehousegrapevine.com/

"Today, the House Republican Conference could not reach consensus on repealing Obamacare. There were too many Members who believed today’s bill did not fully repeal Obamacare.   "If Obamacare has taught us anything, it’s that coverage and care are two very different things. With sky-high deductibles and soaring premiums, having insurance doesn’t mean you can afford to use it. I remain committed to repealing Obamacare. My priority is getting Washington bureaucrats out of the health insurance business and giving the choice and freedom back to the people." - Congressman Kenny Marchant (R-TX)
I'm overjoyed for my son and his family as we welcome my newest grandbaby to the world. Say hello to Walker Ross Marchant.  Mom, dad, and baby are doing well.

ATTN: High School Students! The 2017 Congressional Art Competition is now open! Compete for the grand prize -- to have your work displayed in the United States Capitol for a whole year.  My office is accepting entries from all high school students in the Texas 24th Congressional District. Submissions are allowed in any of the following categories -- Paintings | Drawings | Collages | Prints | Mixed Media | Digital Art | Photography.  See the 2016 Grand Prize winner along with more details here: https://marchant.house.gov/cac/

I joined with my colleagues from the House Committee on Ways and Means in calling for President Trump to remove John Koskinen as Commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service. His legacy at the IRS is one of corruption, incompetence and a betrayal of the public trust.  Read my full statement and the letter my colleagues and I sent to the President: https://marchant.house.gov/2017/04/05/marchant-petitions-trump-administration-remove-irs-commissioner/

Tonight, President Trump acted decisively against a Syrian regime that has brutally murdered men, women, and children with chemical weapons. Read my full statement on the Trump Administration's military actions in Syria.
A little over an hour ago a bipartisan majority of the U.S. Senate voted to confirm Judge Neil Gorsuch as the 113th Justice of the United States Supreme Court.

Late last month a treasured member of our community went to be with the Lord. I want to take a minute to honor our friend and local hero, Cy Young, who passed away on March 23, at the age of 97.   Lieutenant Young served his country in the U.S. Navy during WWII and was a survivor of the Battle of Iwo Jima. After returning from the War, he acquired his Master's degree from the University of North Texas and resumed his Texas High School Football coaching career.  He is listed as an Outstanding High School Football Coach in North Texas. Cy is one of 10 honorees in Bowie High School history to be in the graduate Hall of Honor. He is the Founder of the Iwo Jima Survivors Association  and has a Street named after him in Wichita Falls, TX.  I was fortunate to spend time with Lt. Young at the 2016 Veteran's Fair and recognize him for his service to his community and his country. His legacy will live on in North Texas through the countless lives he influenced during his time here.

Comprehensive tax reform can unleash a wave of economic growth in this country - including over 140,000 new jobs for Texas.   Simple for families, fair and competitive for business, and an IRS that’s accountable to the people. Read my piece in the Star Local Media

Next Saturday morning is the North Texas U.S. Service Academies Forum. One of the great honors of representing Texas' 24th Congressional District is nominating our best and brightest students to our nation's service academies.   If you're a parent with a middle school or high school student, come by the Mansfield ISD Center for the Performing Arts on April 29 from 8am-12pm. Learn more about the academies and the nomination process from ROTC representatives.   If you can't make it next week, don't worry, visit https://marchant.house.gov/serviceacademynominations/ for more information.

Today, the Trump Administration laid out their plan for comprehensive tax reform -- something not done since the Reagan Administration. In Texas, we know that economic prosperity comes from limited government and lower taxes. That's why for over a year, I've been working with my colleagues on the House Committee on Ways and Means, on a framework for comprehensive tax reform.  The Ways and Means Committee is the committee that originates all tax related legislation in Congress. As one of only 23 Republicans on this committee, I've worked hard to find ways to create a tax code that's simple for families, fair and competitive for business and an IRS that's accountable to the people. I look forward to working with everyone at the table to help American families and American businesses have a brighter future.

My office took part in the Special Olympics Awards Ceremony hosted by the Grapevine-Colleyville ISD and Grapevine Rotary. Kaylee Snider received the Athlete of the Year Award for GCISD. Every participant received Congressional Recognition for being Olympic champions! Join me in congratulating Kaylee and all the courageous athletes that participate in the Special Olympics!

Today, I am saddened to hear of the loss of a dear friend and fellow patriot, Joseph Ray Perry. Ray flew over 30 combat missions in the European Theater during World War II as the tail gunner for the B-17 bomber “Heavy Date” heroically earning his place among the greatest generation. I wish to send my sincerest condolences to the Perry family as they celebrate the life of this truly great American.

My prayers are with the North Lake College community. Thank you to the Irving Police Department and North Lake Campus Police for their swift, thorough response to this tragedy. The campus remains on lock down for the remainder of today and tomorrow.

Following the vote in the House of Representatives to advance HR 1628 The American Health Care Act to the Senate, U.S. Congressman Kenny Marchant (TX-24) released the following statement:  "In November, the American people voted for relief from the skyrocketing costs of health insurance. The legacy of Obamacare is out-of-control premiums, fewer choices for patients, and unaffordable deductibles. Today, I voted again to repeal and dismantle Obamacare. After listening to the concerns of my constituents regarding pre-existing conditions, after significant patient protections were added, and after ensuring Congress was not exempted from this legislation, I support advancing this bill to the Senate. American health insurance is in crisis, reform is not a choice, it’s a necessity.  Right now one-third of all counties in the United States have only one insurance option and that number is climbing. Just yesterday it was reported that the entire state of Iowa could be left with no individual options to purchase health insurance in 2018. This crisis won’t fix itself. Millions of Americans have opted to pay a fine to the government and remain uninsured because it’s actually cheaper than Obamacare premiums.  Continued improvements will be made to stabilize the industry that’s crumbling around us. This is about dismantling the Obamacare regulations that have hurt so many families and businesses in Texas. Right now, an elderly couple in Texas making $80,000 a year is mandated by Washington to buy one-size-fits-all insurance they don’t want or need. Under the AHCA, this couple would now receive an $8,000 tax credit to buy insurance that actually fits their lifestyle. Conservative principles like this have been part health insurance discussions for decades.  We’ve seen what happens when Washington bureaucrats take charge of health insurance – health care plans you’re forced to buy but can’t afford to use. Choosing between Obamacare and the American Health Care Act is a false choice, because Obamacare is collapsing. Saying no is easy, saving insurance for American families before it’s gone is worth a yes.”

Today, we commemorate Victory in Europe Day. 72 years ago, the act of military surrender was signed by the Germans, ending World War II.  Our community in North Texas has many members from the greatest generation. We remember them and we thank them. Most importantly, we salute those that gave the greatest sacrifice for our freedom and weren't able to come home. #VEDay #WWII

To all the moms out there - Happy Mother's Day! I'm so grateful for my mom, Helen, pictured here with her newest great grand baby, Walker. She's a strong Texas woman that instilled in me the principles that have guided my life as I raised my own family. Thank you for your selflessness, encouragement and unconditional love.
Congratulations, Pranay! This is an incredible accomplishment! Always great to see fellow DeWitt Perry Eagles succeed.

On this Armed Forces Day, we honor the service and sacrifice of America's Soldiers, Marines, Sailors, Airmen & Guardsman.  Annually, my office highlights the military service of constituents of the 24th District through the Veterans History Project. We pay tribute to their service by sharing their stories.  I want to introduce Nicholas W. Schouten - WWII and Korean War era veteran from Bedford, TX. I encourage you to take a moment to hear his story as well as the many others from previous years. https://marchant.house.gov/veteranshistoryproject/.

Today, we remember the men and women that gave the ultimate sacrifice for the freedoms we enjoy as Americans. With parades and picnics, we often mark this weekend as the unofficial start of summer. As you gather with friends and family, I encourage you to take a moment to reflect on the fallen heroes from our community in North Texas and throughout our nation. They fought bravely and died selflessly serving the nation they loved, fighting for the ideals we hold dear.   I was in Carrollton visiting with some veterans recently, many of their friends and brothers never returned home from duty. They've never been forgotten by their peers and it's our job to make sure they never will be. We pay tribute to the lives of our fallen heroes and remember their sacrifice, not just on Memorial Day, but every day.

On this day in 1944, the allied forces crossed the English Channel and stormed the beaches of Normandy in the name of freedom. Operation Neptune, commonly known as D-Day, began the invasion of Nazi-occupied Western Europe.  We'll never forget the courageous men that fought to liberate from tyranny and those that sacrificed everything for victory.

Under the Dodd-Frank Act, local job creators can't get the capital they need to hire Texans and grow their companies. Community banks are closing at an alarming average of one per day.   The Financial CHOICE Act repeals the job-killing regulations in  Dodd-Frank and enacts the stiffest penalties in history for financial fraud.   Read my full statement and watch my speech on the House floor supporting the Financial CHOICE Act.  -- Statement: https://marchant.house.gov/2017/06/08/marchant-votes-support-growth-main-street-hold-wall-street-accountable/  Floor Speech: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aH85gcuhipE

Last September, The Center for Medicaid Services under the Obama Administration, disallowed over $26 million of Medicaid payments to hospitals in Dallas and Tarrant Counties in my district. Medicaid is specifically designed to serve the under-served members in our community and it's crucial that we fix this.  During a hearing in the Ways and Means Committee this week, I asked the Secretary of Health and Human Services, Dr. Tom Price, about quickly resolving this important issue.

Happy Birthday to fellow Texan and America's 41st President -- George H.W. Bush. 93 years young today!   President Bush has dedicated his life to serving others, join me in thanking him for his service to our great nation and wishing him well on his special day.

Terrible news from Washington this morning. My sincere thanks to the brave men and women of the US Capitol Police and local law enforcement that quickly responded and controlled this situation. My prayers go out to the victims of this morning's events, the Capitol Police Officers, congressional staff, and my colleague Congressman Scalise.
To all the dads out there!

Local businesses and families throughout my district reap the benefits of NAFTA on a daily basis. High-quality jobs and a vibrant economy for our communities are the rewards of good trade policy with our neighbors.   As discussions begin to modernize this agreement, it’s important that we do no harm to the successful policies that have led to economic prosperity throughout Texas. I asked newly confirmed US Trade Representative, Robert Lighthizer, about the path going forward as we move to update this agreement for a 21st century economy.

Today, the House passed two bills which I strongly support:  1) Kate's Law 2) The No Sanctuary for Criminals Act  These two bills give law enforcement the tools they need to protect our communities and enforce the laws of the land to keep Americans safe.

Each spring since 1982, students from all over the country compete in the Congressional Art Competition. Every Member of Congress collects entries from their district and the grand prize winner gets their art displayed in the United States Capitol.  2017 Congressional Art Contest Winner:  "Lazy Day in Downtown Carrollton" by Jeremy Bowden, Hebron H.S.   2017 Congressional Art Contest Runner-up:  "Recruit" by Gabriel Vallejo, Ranchview H.S.  It was an honor to host the family of this year's winner, Jeremy Bowden from Hebron H.S. and the runner-up, Gabriel Vallejo from Ranchview H.S., at our District Office in Irving. Jeremy joined me in Washington this week. His painting "Lazy Day in Downtown Carrollton" is now hanging in the United States Capitol.
241 years ago, members from the thirteen original colonies officially declared themselves the United States of America.  From my family to yours, have a safe and happy 4th of July!

A fun throwback Thursday today. Join me in wishing my friend George W. Bush a happy 71st birthday! Texas' 46th Governor and America's 43rd President, President Bush continues serving others long after leaving public office. Happy Birthday, Mr. President!

One year ago today, five members of the Dallas Police Department were gunned down in a senseless massacre that shocked our community. They gave the ultimate sacrifice protecting and serving the people of North Texas. Thank you to the courageous men and women that dawn the shield each day patrolling our neighborhoods, protecting our loved ones and upholding the rule of law.  #ThinBlueLine #NeverForget

Today in a Ways and Means Tax Subcommittee Hearing, I was able to ask small business owners, including one from Texas, how the tax reform we're working on in Congress would help them grow and create jobs.

Congress is continuing the important work of pro-growth tax reform. We need comprehensive reform that fixes our broken tax code and makes it simpler for families and more competitive for local businesses.  After last week's hearing focusing on tax reform for small businesses, this week in the Committee on Ways and Means, I spoke with a panel of experts about how simplifying our tax code will help families and individuals.

This week I joined the North Texas Food Bank at Metrocrest Services in Farmers Branch. Organizations like these provide nutritious meals, household and school supplies, employment assistance, and counseling to families and individuals in need. But the most important thing they provide is HOPE to North Texans during difficult situations in their life. It's a great example of many different parts of our community coming together to offer a hand-up and not just a hand-out.

This year we honored a record 62 young men that achieved the rank of Eagle Scout from around the Texas 24th Congressional District. This was our 12th Annual Eagle Scout Recognition Ceremony and it seems to grow larger every year. We provide a forum for each participant to talk about their Eagle Scout service project to the over 200 attendees. Following the ceremony they're presented with a congressional certificate of recognition and flag that was flown over the United States Capitol for each of them.   We're grateful to our keynote speaker this year, Don McChesney, Assistant Chief Scout Executive/ National Director of Field Service for Boy Scouts of America.  As the father of an Eagle Scout, I know the hard work and dedication it takes to receive this great award. I applaud the purposeful commitment they've made to serving our North Texas community. These young men truly exemplify the Scout Law: A Scout is trustworthy, loyal, helpful, friendly, courteous, kind, obedient, cheerful, thrifty, brave, clean, and reverent.  Story Here: https://marchant.house.gov/2017/08/16/record-number-north-texas-eagle-scouts-recognized-annual-event/

Today we celebrate National Senior Citizens Day. I have enjoyed listening to the concerns of seniors across the district. I will continue to work to save both Medicare and Social Security and to strengthen these programs for future generations. Our seniors deserve the peace of mind and certainty that the programs they have been planning their retirement around will be there when they need them.  My continued goal is to ensure that Medicare and Social Security meet the needs of seniors and taxpayers, now and into the future.

After starting with two employees and a desire to provide an affordable solution to a friend’s back pain, VARIDESK has engineered their way into the furniture industry and in just a few short years has grown to 200 employees; based in the heart of the 24th District.   VARIDESK is revolutionizing the ergonomic office furniture industry with their height-adjustable standing desks and office accessories. Their successes and those of small businesses like them rely on pro-business policies that enable growth and job creation.  By continuing to improve the economic and regulatory environments our small businesses, like VARIDESK, operate in, we will continue creating careers and growing opportunities that strengthen the American middle-class.
Watch NASA's coverage of today's solar eclipse!

Congressman Kenny Marchant (TX-24) made this statement following President Trump’s outline of the New American Strategy for Afghanistan:  “Terrorism and extremism must never go unchecked. The advisors surrounding President Trump are some of the best military minds in the world. They command the greatest fighting force in the world and are equipped with the greatest arsenal in the world.  “This year my colleagues and I already passed legislation to strengthen our military. The courageous men and women protecting our country will have my full support in winning the war in Afghanistan, defeating terrorism around the globe, and keeping Americans safe.”

Small Businesses drive the American economy and strengthen our communities at home.   Access to capital can be a serious barrier to growth for small businesses, Which is why earlier this year the House passed The Small Business Investment Opportunity Act to expand the amount of capital available to the entrepreneurs in North Texas to help them grow their operations.  I had the opportunity to discuss this and tax reform with Tarrant County small business owners in Bedford. Providing middle-class tax relief and eliminating burdensome regulations on small businesses is key to strengthening the economy, promoting job growth and North Texas.

I recently visited PrimeSource Building Products, headquartered in Irving to see how they serve the construction industry and work to provide quality building supplies to countless contractors, homebuilders, and homeowners across the country. Primesource employs over 1200 people making it one of the largest building material distributors in North America.

It was a great pleasure to meet with Paul Howard, President of Neuro Fitness Foundation in Euless. Neuro Fitness Foundation is a non-profit organization that provides a specialized gym for strength and cardiovascular training for individuals with neurological issues and related lifestyle challenges.   Neuro Fitness Foundation is a one of a kind facility in North Texas. Paul and his team have done tremendous work helping the disabled gain mobility and strength to become more self-sufficient. For more information about this organization, please visit: http://neurofitnessfoundation.org/

My thoughts and prayers are with the millions of Texans who will be in the path of Hurricane Harvey this weekend.  Up to date weather information can be found at https://www.weather.gov  Preparedness tips and other instructional resources can be found at https://www.ready.gov/hurricanes  FEMA's mobile app is available for Android and Apple devices and can provide emergency alerts, safety reminders, and locate shelter during emergencies:  https://www.fema.gov/mobile-app

As the 2017-2018 school year kicks-off, I want to thank Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD Trustee Richard Fleming for visiting with me about the priorities for the upcoming school year. Good luck to the all the students, teachers, and administrators as they begin another productive school year!

The Texas Task Force 2 has been mobilized to aid in Hurricane Harvey response. This exceptional group of search and rescue professionals includes many members of our community. The Bedford, Carrollton, DFW Airport, Euless, Farmers Branch, and Irving Fire Departments are all part of this task force. Thank you to all the brave men and women that run toward these natural disasters to help their fellow Texans. Our prayers remain with with the victims of this catastrophic event and with everyone involved in the ongoing relief efforts.   Along with first responders, there are many ways that you can help the relief efforts surrounding Harvey. Volunteering, donating supplies to local centers, donating blood, providing monetary support, and much more. Here's a list of ways to help.

It was a pleasure meeting with Bill Dewey and the National Air Traffic Controllers Association to discuss air safety and its tremendous importance to our national transportation infrastructure, specifically at DFW International Airport. The safety and security of our skies is vital to the continued success of the United States.

Our community is stepping up to help the victims of Hurricane Harvey but this will be a long-term effort. Here are three ways to support our fellow Texans, visit http://www.dallashelpforharvey.net/ to learn more.   1) VOLUNTEER: https://www.voly.org/disaster/  2) DONATE RESOURCES: Trusted World is accepting donations. 15660 N. Dallas Parkway, Dallas, TX 75248. Donations are accepted Monday through Friday (through Sept. 1) and may be dropped off from 3:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.  Needed Items: > New underwear > New socks > New warmups for men, women, children and infants > Pillows, pillow cases and blankets > Flip flops for showers > Towels and wash cloths > Toiletries/hygiene products > Baby formula and baby wipes, bottles, diapers > Graco Pack n’ Plays for babies to sleep in

Macho Storage, located at 6511 Colleyville Blvd in Colleyville, is collecting items for the hurricane victims.  Donna Ducey, with Macho Storage, will be answering the phone and door until 10:00 pm each night to accept deliveries.    They have drivers and trucks to deliver items, but if you have a truck and would like to drive items, please call Donna at (817)488-2754.  Items most needed:    Baby formula & food    Diapers & Wipes    Bottled water    Medical supplies including OTC medicines, vinyl gloves,     walkers and wheelchairs    Plus-sized clothes    Baby and children's clothes    Toiletries such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, mouthwash, toilet     tissue, tissues, paper towels, hand sterilizers, deodorant,     shampoo, cream rinse, sunscreen, etc.    Pet food, leashes, bedding, and cages (for pet safety in     crowded conditions)  They will be transporting goods to areas most needed.

From Dallas to Southlake, Carrollton to Hurst, we covered every part of the 24th District in August.  We have a busy agenda for the rest of 2017 and I look forward to taking the views you shared with me back to Washington. It's an honor to represent our North Texas community in the U.S. House of Representatives.

I had the pleasure of presenting the three newest mayors in the 24th District with these handmade gavels, crafted from oak branches from the grounds of the United States Capitol. I look forward to working with Mayor Rick Stopfer of Irving, Mayor Kevin Falconer of Carrollton, and Mayor Robert Dye of Farmers Branch to continue making our North Texas community strong and vibrant.

Congressman Kenny Marchant (TX-24) released this statement following the announcement by the Trump Administration on the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program:  “For the last eight years we saw unprecedented overreach by the Executive Branch. The Obama Administration undermined the democratic process by unilaterally creating immigration policy through executive order. Today, President Trump kept his promise to end the DACA program before the courts found it illegal and invalid. I’ll continue working with my colleagues in Congress to secure our borders, enforce and uphold the rule of law, reform our legal immigration system and put American workers first.”

The recovery and rebuilding process has begun for the victims of Hurricane Harvey. The entire Texas delegation, Republicans and Democrats, all joined together today to share experiences, discuss next steps, and find solutions for the communities affected by this catastrophe. #TexansHelpingTexans

After voting in favor of disaster relief funding for the victims of Hurricane Harvey, Congressman Kenny Marchant (R-Texas) made this statement:  https://marchant.house.gov/2017/09/08/providing-disaster-relief-victims-hurricane-harvey/     “Earlier this week, the House of Representatives joined the entire Texas delegation to vote overwhelmingly in favor of providing disaster relief funds to those affected by the catastrophic storm – Hurricane Harvey.     “I must express my disappointment that after I voted to send this legislation to the Senate, the families and individuals uprooted by Harvey were used as political pawns to continue Washington’s habit of kicking the fiscal can down the road. By attaching spending unassociated with disaster relief and language to raise our nation’s debt ceiling without any reforms, the Senate played politics with the victims of this horrific disaster.     “The process of rebuilding must move forward, and I’ll continue to work in a bipartisan way to support my fellow Texans on that long journey. Harvey damaged homes and tragically took lives from our Texas family, but it could not damage our Texas spirit. While we can never replace all that was lost due to Harvey, we can begin the rebuilding process and provide hope to our neighbors in need.”

16 years ago today our nation changed forever. Each year on 9/11, members of our community place wreaths and flags at the 9/11 Flight Crew Memorial in Grapevine. We will never forget the heroism displayed by the first responders at Ground Zero, at the Pentagon, and by the passengers and crew on flight 93. Their bravery saved the lives of countless Americans. Join me in celebrating their lives, honoring the ultimate sacrifice they made, and remembering the lives tragically lost that day.

Today, the Committee on Ways and Means unanimously passed my legislation, HR 3726, The Stark Administrative Simplification Act. Read my full statement and more about this bill below.   “The modernizations to the “Stark” Law agreed upon by Republicans and Democrats in the Ways and Means Committee will alleviate the back-log of burdensome disclosures and allow the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) to focus on the bad actors in our medical system.  “Most importantly, these hard-fought reforms will allow the healthcare providers in North Texas to get back to doing what they do best – serving, treating, and healing my constituents.  “I urge swift action by the whole House and the Senate so we can send HR 3726 to the President’s desk for his signature.”   https://marchant.house.gov/2017/09/13/marchant-legislation-modernize-stark-law-unanimously-passes-committee/

Today, a bipartisan majority in the House passed legislation to combat gang violence and keep our communities safe. HR 3697, the Criminal Alien Gang Member Removal Act, ensures that alien gang members are not eligible for immigration benefits and are detained and removed from the United States if they participate in gang activity.   We're giving law enforcement more tools to keep our streets and families safe. For more info on HR 3697 visit the House Judiciary Committee at www.Judiciary.House.Gov

September 15 is National POW-MIA Recognition Day. Today and every day we remember our Prisoners of War like my friend and colleague Congressman Sam Johnson, who spent 42 months as a POW in Vietnam. To the servicemen and servicewomen who are Missing in Action and their families - you are not forgotten.  Thank you to the soldiers, airmen, marines, guardsmen and sailors, past and present, for your service to our nation. We're eternally grateful for the sacrifices you've made to keep America safe.
Happy Birthday to the United States Air Force! God bless our Airmen for 70 years of distinguished service to our great nation. Fly-Fight-Win!

One of the most important functions in my office is one you'll rarely hear on the news. Helping constituents with issues they're having at federal agencies is a primary service my district office provides in Irving.   In this case, our Military & Veterans Affairs Liaison, John Hayes, helped Roberta from Southlake receive benefits from the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs that she earned through her years of dedicated service to our nation. My staff and I do everything we can to answer your questions and cut through the red tape. Let us know if we can help you!  Visit https://marchant.house.gov/casework/ for more information

This editorial by The Dallas Morning News talks about the unique opportunity we have to reform our broken tax code and provide meaningful relief to middle-class families, individuals and local businesses throughout our country.  https://www.dallasnews.com/opinion/editorials/2017/09/21/president-trump-congress-great-opportunity-reform-tax-code
I agree with Jason Witten.

My colleagues and I joined President Trump and Vice President Pence in the Roosevelt Room at the White House. We share a common goal - bigger paychecks for hardworking Americans. By fixing our broken tax code we can accomplish this goal.

A simpler and fairer tax code is the key to more money in the pockets of hardworking families. For too long we've lived with a tax code that's overly complicated, uncompetitive and unfair. In Texas, we know that the ingredients for economic growth are limited government and lower taxes. This framework is the foundation for real tax relief and economic growth in America.

Today the House passed "Micah's Law," a life-saving piece of legislation that I cosponsored, named after Micah Pickering. After being born at 22 weeks, Micah is now a vibrant child entering kindergarten. If a little baby is able to feel pain, and thrive with proper medical care, we should protect them.

I had a wonderful time visiting with constituents at today's Empowering Seniors event, hosted by Tarrant County Commissioner Gary Fickes​! This annual event introduces nearly two thousand senior citizens in Tarrant County to local services and organizations with a focus on maintaining independence and improving the lives of our seniors!  With on site services such as hearing and vision exams, flu shots, and informational workshops Empowering Seniors provides a tremendous service to Tarrant County's senior community!
Join me in wishing a happy birthday to my dear friend and American hero, Congressman Sam Johnson! Thank you for your continued service to our country.

Today, I voted against a $16 Billion taxpayer bailout of the NFIP. Here's my thoughts:   Without reforms to unfunded government programs like the National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP), I could not vote to allow my constituents to be on the hook to pay for these bloated government programs that time and time again, saddle our children and grandchildren with mountains of debt.   I’ve been working to provide tax relief and simplify our broken tax code so that American workers and families can keep more of their paychecks. Our national debt is already over $20 trillion and climbing, I cannot support a taxpayer bailout of the NFIP without any reforms that would make it sustainable.

This week I sent a letter to the Commissioner of the IRS after the shocking revelation that they gave a no-bid contract for fraud-prevention to Equifax worth $7.25 million. Until a company can prove they can securely handle sensitive information of private citizens, they have no business being awarded taxpayer dollars for a service.   I applaud the ongoing investigations into Equifax by the committees of jurisdiction in Congress to ensure breaches of this magnitude never happen again. I'm glad the IRS has suspended this contract, it's mind-boggling why it would be given in the first place.  Read My Full Letter Here: https://marchant.house.gov/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/KM-Letter-to-IRS-Equifax.pdf

Main Street businesses across America, like the ones here in North Texas, are faced with a broken, burdensome tax code that makes it harder to grow. By lowering the tax rate for small businesses to 25% - the lowest since before WWII - we're increasing their competitiveness around the world and helping them create new jobs in our communities.  Learn more about the plan to fix our broken tax code here: https://fairandsimple.gop/?utm_source=repkenmarchant

Texas workers deserve a raise. The current tax code facing American companies rewards expansion overseas instead of growth here at home. I’m working to create a tax code that helps local businesses win again in the global economy and gives the American worker a raise.   A recent study by the Council of Economic Advisors looked at how household income would rise an average of $4,000 for American families with the reforms under our framework. This bold agenda will increase America’s competitiveness around the world and grow family budgets at home.  Council of Economic Advisors Study: https://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/whitehouse.gov/files/documents/Tax%20Reform%20and%20Wages.pdf  View the Unified Framework to Fix Our Broken Tax Code Here: www.FairandSimple.gop

We need to modernize America’s outdated and uncompetitive tax code. It’s been 31 years since any significant changes. The status quo hurts American workers and American job creators.   By unrigging our tax code and making it easier for American companies to bring home profits that are currently stranded overseas, we can grow jobs and paychecks in our communities.  Here’s how ➡️ www.FairandSimple.gop

With a federal tax code that's over 70,000 pages, a key part of tax reform is eliminating loopholes created by Washington special interests. That's how you achieve lower tax rates so that you and your family keep more of your money.   Read more about closing those loopholes here: https://fairandsimple.gop

Today marks 31 years since the last time comprehensive tax legislation received a Presidential signature -- President Reagan on October 22, 1986.   It's time to bring our tax code into the 21st century with bold, pro-growth reforms that help American job creators and American workers win again.   Based on the Framework below, Congress is working on legislation to do exactly that.  Our goals are focused on more jobs, fairer taxes, and bigger paychecks.   View Framework details at www.FairandSimple.gop  (photo credit: ap)

Identity theft is one of the most frustrating crimes a person can endure.   Situations like the one described in this article are exactly why I introduced the Social Security Child Protection Act. I look forward to moving this bill through Congress and sending it to the President's desk.  Learn more about my bill to reform the Social Security Administration here: http://bit.ly/2l8BfFE
As investigations into the 2016 elections continue, new information recently surfaced about the funding sources for research into alleged connections between Russian officials and President Trump.

Congressman Marchant issued this statement following the House passing its budget for FY 2018:  “The key to creating jobs, improving wages and growing salaries at every level of our economy is overhauling our outdated and uncompetitive tax code. Passing this budget clears the way for once-in-a-generation tax relief that touches every sector of our economy.  “We are one step closer to reforming a crippling tax code that hurts American workers and hinders American businesses. Tax reform that impacts everyone unleashes economic growth that leaves no one behind.”

The targeting of non-profit organizations by the IRS based on ones name or ideology were shameful activities. Since our first hearings on this issue, senior officials at the IRS continued to dance around any wrongdoings. Ultimately, the truth came out and this week the Department of Justice made it clear that those actions would not be condoned.   Read the timeline of oversight for IRS targeting here: https://marchant.house.gov/legislationirstargetinginvestigation-htm/

The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act is a historic step toward fixing America's broken, outdated, uncompetitive tax code and rejecting the failed status quo that drives jobs overseas and leads to poor wage growth.  At www.marchant.house.gov/taxreform, you can...   > read my full statement on the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act  > see the full text of the legislation  > find helpful resources talking about how we're making our tax code work better for local businesses in North Texas and easier to navigate for Texas workers and their families   https://marchant.house.gov/taxreform/

A 2017 global economy requires an American tax code from 2017 -- not one from 1986. Tax reform is for the working families and individuals in North Texas that are ready for increased wages from a booming economy for everyone. It's for the local businesses that right now are at a disadvantage compared to their competitors overseas. We're refusing to live with the broken status quo by leveling the playing field and simplifying our tax code for all Americans.   Learn More ➡ www.FairAndSimple.gop ⬅
Tonight on the floor of Congress, a moment of silence was offered out of respect for the victims of yesterday’s horrific attack in Sutherland Springs.

A company that employs tens of thousands of North Texans, including many right here in the 24th district, is ready to increase their investment in America when we make our tax code more competitive for American companies. An investment with the practical application of 7,000 middle-income jobs.  This is a real life example of the economic growth when we reject the status quo and level the playing field for local companies competing in this global economy.   AT&T announced earlier today that if a competitive tax rate is enacted -- as it would be under the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act -- the company would invest an additional $1 billion in the United States.
Happy Birthday, Marines! 242 years of honor, courage and commitment.
It was a great honor to be with so many North Texas veterans in Grapevine today for our sixth annual Veterans Fair! Thank you to  all who have served in defense of our nation!!

Passing the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act was a major step toward fixing a broken tax code that's uncompetitive for American companies and unfair for American workers.   Today, Congress moved closer to delivering real tax relief to the families, individuals, and businesses in North Texas and throughout the country.    ⬇ Watch my floor speech about the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act ⬇    Visit www.FairandSimple.gop to learn how this bill helps hardworking taxpayers throughout their lives   -- Remarks as prepared for delivery:  “Mr. Speaker, I rise in support of HR 1, the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.  This is an historic opportunity to reject the status quo and provide real tax relief to the families, individuals and businesses in my district.  America’s tax code is broken – it is uncompetitive for American companies and it is unfair for American workers.  The American people deserve a tax code that works for them, not one that works for the special interests in Washington.  They deserve a tax code that rewards their lifetime of hard work, not one that squeezes their savings. And they deserve a tax code that prioritizes their goals, not one that penalizes success.  The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act creates a tax code that is focused on growth, fairness, and a booming economy for everyone.  The reforms in this bill, level the playing field for small businesses in North Texas, giving them the opportunity to grow and hire more people. And allow the hardworking taxpayers I represent to keep more of their paycheck and increase their family’s budget.  I’d like to thank the Chairman for allowing me to represent the views of my constituents throughout this process and I urge my colleagues to take advantage of this historic opportunity and vote in favor of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.”

My prayers are with the family of Border Patrol Agent Rogelio Martinez who was killed in the line of duty this weekend near Van Horn, TX. His partner remains in the hospital with serious injuries. We’re so thankful for the brave men and women who safeguard our borders and keep our communities safe. We must make sure they have every resource available to do their jobs.

As we give thanks this week I want to share my great and unwavering appreciation for our veterans and all who have served in defense of our nation. Their courage and commitment have ensured the safety and continuity of the American dream for over two hundred and forty years! #weekofthanks

During this #WeekofThanks I want to recognize and give thanks to the men and women who have served this nation in the defense of freedom.  First Lieutenant Louis Hulme served as a transport pilot in the United States Army from March 12, 1944 until February 13, 1946. 1LT Hulme was assigned to the Pacific Theater where he operated in the Western Pacific, Southern Philippines, Luzon, New Guinea, and the Bismark Archipelago.   1LT Hulme earned several decorations and citations for his service in World War II, however he was never awarded his medals upon discharge from the Army, which is common for many veterans from this era. Earlier this year my office was contacted by Thom Hulme, son of Louis, seeking assistance with the recovery of these decorations from the United States Government.   On Veterans Day I had the great pleasure of presenting 1LT Hulme’s decorations to his family at the 2017 Veterans Fair. The following awards were included in the presentation:  Presidential Unit Citation Honorable Service Lapel Button, WWII Philippine Liberation Ribbon, w/ Bronze Service Star Air Medal, w/ Bronze Oak Leaf Cluster American Campaign Medal Asiatic-Pacific Campaign Medal, w/ Silver Service Star World War II Victory Medal

Another Veteran I want to give thanks for during this #WeekofThanks is Airman First Class Paul King. Mr. King served as a jet aircraft mechanic in the United States Air Force from February 14, 1963 until February 14, 1967. Mr. King was active during the Vietnam War and earned several decorations while in the United States Air Force; none of which were presented to him upon his discharge from service.  On November 11, 2017 I had the great honor of presenting Mr. King with his earned awards from his service in the United States Air Force. The following commendations were presented to Mr. King:  Air Force Outstanding Unit Award Air Force Good Conduct Medal Republic of Vietnam Campaign Medal Vietnam Service Medal National Defense Service Medal  It is tragic that so many of our Nation’s heroes have not received their earned awards and commendations from the United States Government. My office takes pride in providing this service to the Veterans of the 24th Congressional District, if you are aware of any military veterans currently experiencing difficulty in acquiring their earned awards or benefits, please contact my District Office at (972) 556-0162 for assistance.

As we continue our #WeekofThanks and join with family and friends today, let’s also remember those away from their families right now because they’ve answered the call to protect and defend our freedoms.  We can never say thank you enough for the service and sacrifice of those currently serving in our Armed Forces and we’re grateful to our veterans that spent many holidays away from home.  From my family to yours, Happy Thanksgiving.

On #SmallBusinessSaturday we highlight the cornerstone of the American economy — the main street small business. They employ 4.5 million Texans and make up 98% of all Texas businesses.   By passing the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act in the House, long overdue tax relief is on the way for the local businesses in North Texas and around the country. Providing the lowest small business tax rate since WWII and the ability to immediately write off pro-growth company improvements helps our small businesses become the job creation engines of tomorrow.

The Dallas Fort Worth International Airport should be considered as the nation's premier transportation hub and it will only improve with these projects. I am honored to represent DFW Airport in Congress and look forward to seeing the impacts these improvements will have on air-travel, trade and job creation in North Texas.  A leader in passenger and commercial aviation, the DFW Airport contributes $37 Billion to the North Texas economy. Learn more about the FAA's Airport Improvement Program Grant https://marchant.house.gov/2017/11/28/dfw-airport-receives-aip-grant/

The men and women of our military deserve the very best. With threats to our way of life increasing around the globe, we cannot ask them to accomplish their missions and defend our country without giving them the resources to win.  Providing for the common defense is one of our greatest Constitutional obligations. The FY 2018 National Defense Authorization Act, sent today from Capitol Hill to the White House, is a crucial step toward rebuilding our armed forces. The NDAA authorizes the largest troop pay raise in eight years, ensures our readiness, improves our infrastructure and modernizes our arsenal.  I was glad to see 344 Members of the House of Representatives and 89 Senators support our troops and send this legislation to the President's desk.

The decision handed down in the case of Kate Steinle’s murder is tragic, even more tragic is the fact that her death was completely preventable. American Cities that endanger their citizens by releasing illegal aliens back onto the streets, directly disobeying federal law enforcement, put innocent lives at risk. We must enforce our laws, secure our borders, and enable law enforcement to do their jobs and protect our communities.   I strongly support the No Sanctuary for Criminals Act (H.R. 3003) and Kate’s Law (H.R. 3004) – named after Kate Steinle. These pieces of legislation passed the House earlier this year and I hope they reach the President’s Desk soon.  **No Sanctuary for Criminals Act, HR 3003  Passed the House 228-195  Strengthens existing law to combat sanctuary policies that shield unlawful and criminal immigrants from federal immigration enforcement.  **Kate’s Law, HR 3004 Passed the House 257-167 Named after Kate Steinle, who was murdered in San Francisco by an illegal immigrant who had previously been deported five times and was convicted of multiple felonies. The bill provides that a criminal alien, previously convicted of any three misdemeanors or any felony would, upon conviction for illegal reentry, be subject to a maximum sentence of 10 years.
Welcoming my new grandson to the world - Neyland Marchant Stringfellow. Mother and baby are healthy and our hearts are full.

Our new administration has prioritized lawful immigration, securing our border, and enhancing public safety.  Earlier today, Immigration And Customs Enforcement (ICE) and U.S. Customs and Border Patrol released their year-end immigration enforcement report.  Border Patrol arrests are at their lowest levels since 1971,  down 25% from the same period last year. Arrests of MS-13 gang members are up 83 percent and captures of illegals with criminal records are up 92 percent.  >> Learn more about the report here: https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/dhs-announces-progress-enforcing-immigration-laws-protecting-americans

I spoke on the House Floor in favor of HR 38 the Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act passed today by the House. I cosponsored this legislation because our Constitutional rights should travel with us no matter what state we are in.   Read my full statement here: https://marchant.house.gov/2017/12/06/marchant-votes-protect-constitutional-rights-law-abiding-gun-owners/  MARCHANT VOTES TO PROTECT CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS OF LAW-ABIDING GUN OWNERS  Washington, D.C. – U.S. Congressman Kenny Marchant (TX-24) released this statement following his vote in favor of the Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act (HR38) that passed the House 231-198:   “The Constitutional rights of North Texans don’t end when they enter another state,” said Marchant.  “The Second Amendment of the United States Constitution protects the right for my constituents and people throughout our country to ‘keep and bear arms.’ The Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act protects the rights of law-abiding gun owners with a state-issued concealed carry license to freely travel from state-to-state without fear of harassment.  “Over two-thirds of the states in this country already have concealed carry reciprocity with Texas. Just like their driver’s license, this legislation ensures that the Constitutional rights of my constituents and of all Americans follow them to every state.”

To commemorate National Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day, I laid a wreath earlier today at the World War II Memorial in Washington, D.C. Let us never forget the 2,403 Sailors, Marines Soldiers and civilians that lost their life in the surprise attack 76 years ago, December 7, 1941.   On this somber day, I encourage you to hear the story of a local North Texas member of the greatest generation. Pearl Harbor survivor, Petty Officer Barton Dale Messler of Irving graciously agreed to be part of our Veterans History Project.  Watch here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-srMjxdwcCk

I applaud the decision by the Department of Justice to investigate these serious allegations. I’ll continue to stand for those without a voice of their own. Innocent human life should be protected and treasured. Read the full story of the DOJ investigating Planned Parenthood for its practices and the sale of fetal tissue below.  http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/12/07/planned-parenthood-under-investigation-by-justice-department-over-sale-fetal-tissue.html

The United States has no stronger ally in the Middle East than the State of Israel, and the people of Israel have no greater partner than the United States. For over 3,000 years, Jerusalem has been the Jewish capital. I cosponsored legislation recognizing Jerusalem as the capital city of the State of Israel and I will continue to support the safety, security and prosperity of our friends in Israel.  Congress originally passed the Jerusalem Embassy Act in 1995 and these positions were unanimously reaffirmed by the Senate this past June, 90-0.  Read my full statement on the Administration's efforts to recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel.

The recent terror attack in New York City is the latest example of how the American immigration system fails our citizens and compromises our national security. We must end dangerous chain migration and secure America’s borders to keep our families and communities safe.  I cosponsored the Immigration in the National Interest Act (H.R. 3775) currently in the Judiciary Committee. It is a crucial step toward putting American safety and security first.  Learn more here: https://marchant.house.gov/2017/12/12/terror-attack-spotlights-urgent-need-strengthen-immigration-system/

Your tax dollars should not be used to fund sexual harassment settlements in Congress. That's why I'm a cosponsor of HR 4494 The Congressional Accountability and Hush Fund Elimination Act.   This bill:  ➡ Prohibits the future use of taxpayer dollars to pay sexual harassment and sexual assault claims against members of Congress and staff.  ➡ Prohibits members of Congress from using office budgets to camouflage payments.  ➡ Requires members of Congress and staff that have ever been named in a sexual harassment or sexual assault settlement paid for by taxpayers reimburse the U.S. Treasury with interest.  ➡ Allows any individual who received an award to make public statements about the claims notwithstanding the terms of a nondisclosure agreement and nondisclosure agreements cannot be made a condition of any future settlements.   Swift action should be taken to move this bill through Congress. Learn more about the Congressional Accountability and Hush Fund Elimination Act below.

It was great to visit with these middle schoolers from North Texas and show them the United States Capitol during their trip to Washington, D.C. With this next generation of leaders, the great state of Texas has a bright future.
There was a sharply dressed special guest on the House floor, this is my nine month old grandbaby, Walker.

Over 20,000 new regulations were created by the Obama Administration, finding new ways for the government to interfere in our daily lives.   Congress and the new Administration came into this year committed to cutting red tape in Washington, D.C. Less regulation saves taxpayers money, lets small businesses grow and create jobs, and increases freedom for all Americans. The goal was to cut two rules for every one created.   This week, the Administration delivered its progress report to Congress. Instead of a 2 to 1 ratio, federal agencies have rolled back regulations at a rate of 22 to 1. Saving taxpayers over $8 billion in the process.  Read about the savings from 2017 and projections for 2018 below.

Bringing our tax code into the 21st century is a critical step toward unleashing America’s full economic potential. The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act rejects the status quo in Washington, D.C. and delivers lasting tax relief for families, individuals and job creators in North Texas.   In 2018, taxpayers at every income level will see their taxes cut under the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. We are replacing our broken tax code with one that incentivizes companies to invest and create jobs in America instead of overseas, boosts paychecks and increases family budgets.  Read my full statement and watch my floor speech on this once in a generation tax relief.
From my family to yours, Merry Christmas!
